column4: I'm using Anjuntu, I wrote a program in C++ by following directions from "C++ For Dummies," I don't know how to execute it and run it now, there's no option and I've been searching for a while. Could it be a plugin?
arvauspeli.cpp -Wall -g -o arvauspeli
what is that? Should I replace "arvauspeli.cpp" with my program name?
yeah, that's my own program :D
awesome thanks, what does that do exactly if you don't my me asking?
so I copy exactly what you wrote, then do ./myprogram ?
got it, thanks!
I just did that, it said "bash: conversation.cpp: command not found"
conversation.cpp is the program
I think you have to download some library
man... ok haha.
let me check :D
type 'sudo apt-get install g++'
ok, thanks a lot for finding that out. I was looking on the anjuta site and I read something about g++ but there was a list... I got a little confused I guess. Thank you though
or you can go to synaptic packet manager and install from there
I already have it
well then go to synaptic package manager
and search for 'g++'
wait, is the command simply "$program.cpp -Wall -g -o program name" ?
yeah
ok i wanted to make sure I had it right. I'm going to be afk for a bit, thanks for the help so far I appreciate it
